results.title: In black and white
results.creator_credit: John Rawdon, Hindle Marriott Edgar, James Carr and World Wide Pictures
results.brief_description: Presents paper as the mainstay of civilisation and as an instrument of immortality for the works of great men. Follows the development of paper-making from the production of single sheets by hand and then (early 19th century) by machine from rag-pulp. Perfected by an Englishman on the basis of a French invention, and fed by wood-pulp as suggested by the French scientist Reaumur a century before, this machine grew into the giant production lines seen at the close of the film.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Rawdon, Hindle Marriott Edgar, James Carr and World Wide Pictures

results.title: In balance
results.brief_description: Two brothers who are partners in a fishing boat business discuss how the profits of their partnership should be managed and from this discussion two points of view emerge. Others enter into the argument and present illustrations of a balanced management of profits. The film describes various ways in which the profits of a company may be used presenting views of employees, shareholders and management.

results.title: In all weathers
results.creator_credit: John Rhodes, R.K. Neilson Baxter and Basic Films
results.brief_description: One of the greatest hazards in marine navigation, poor visibility, has in the past caused much loss of time, money and often life. Before the advent of radar the problem was without solution. This film explains the history of radar, the difficulties faced and overcome in its adaption to marine operation, and finally its inestimable value as a navigational aid.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Rhodes, R.K. Neilson Baxter and Basic Films

results.title: In all seasons
results.creator_credit: Ernest Reid, Desmond Dew and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The Atmospheric Environment Service (AES) is Canada’s weather bureau. The AES supplies weather forecasts and information on climate patterns. Our well-being depends on a knowledge of the weather. This film shows the AES in operation in a country where there are “four seasons - every week.”
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ernest Reid, Desmond Dew and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: In a manner of speaking
results.creator_credit: Colin Dean and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Illustrates how the telephone can be used to conduct efficient business, and how good habits will improve relations with clients on the telephone. Advice is given on aids to switch-board staff to generally facilitate service to clients. Camera and lighting by Frank Bagnall and George Lowe.

results.title: In a Box
results.creator_credit: Eliot Noyes, Robert Verrall and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A short animated film of line drawings suggesting the predicament of people who find themselves boxed in by life. It takes only a few deft strokes of the animator’s pen to show how people’s lives are limited by their own view of things. The box they are in may not fit; it may be uncomfortable in many ways, but they rush back to its familiarity, if not security, even though brief sorties outside may show them a bigger world. (Awards: Columbus; Rome)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eliot Noyes, Robert Verrall and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: [Impulses]
results.creator_credit: Peter Baylis and North Atlantic Treaty Organization
results.brief_description: The story of the technical and scientific means of communication: cable, radio and television. These three forms of communication are bridging the gulf of distance and bringing humans closer together.

results.title: Impudence does not pay
results.creator_credit: Bruno I. Botige and Progress Film
results.brief_description: A black and white silhouette film for children telling the story of a gorilla who steals his hunter’s rifle and helmet, after an exciting episode, and then taunts the other animals, even riding on a lion’s back. Finally they can bear it no longer and toss him from his hammock into the open jaws of a crocodile Music only

results.title: Improvised drama. No.2

results.title: Improvised drama. No.1
results.brief_description: An inquiry into the value to the English teacher of improvised drama in the classroom. Shows an unrehearsed drama lesson with a class of third year secondary students, and work with a class of fourteen year old boys.
